dmca.title: Copyright and trademark infringement athttp://thelema93.atspace.com colocated or host
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Ordo Templi Orientis [mailto:oto_legal_department@mac.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, March 01, 2006 11:14 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Cc: Clarida, Robert; karsten.gutsche@berlin.de
Subject: Copyright and trademark infringement athttp://thelema93.atspace.com
colocated or hosted by theplanet.com 

Ordo Templi Orientis
(a not-for-profit California religious exempt corporation) JAF Box 7666 New
York, NY 10116 legal@oto.org

March 2, 2006

Atspace.com
Zettg Hosting Solutions
Steenbeker Weg 16
24106 Kiel
Germany
support@zettahost.com

   --- and ---

ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. and all subsidiaries George Poletes,
Corporate Counsel
1333 Stemmons Freeway, Suite 110
Dallas, TX 75207
(214) 782-7800
(214) 782-7756 fax

By email to support@zettahost.com
By email to copyright@theplanet.com

Re copyright and trademark infringement at http://thelema93.atspace.com

Dear Sir/Madam

The website at thelema93.atspace.com traceroutes (on inquiry from the United
States) to www.theplanet.com, which indicated a server colocated or sited in
the United States. I contacted customer service at Theplanet.com and
inquired about the atspace.com website, and was courteously given
confirmation that atspace.com content resided on a server there. I am
therefore writing to both Atspace/Zetta Hosting Solutions in Germany, and to
Theplanet.com in the United States.

The website http://thelema93.atspace.com infringes our copyrights and
trademarks. These activities should, we believe, be a violation of paragraph
6 of the Atspace.com Terms of Service.

Pursuant to the terms of legal notification of the Digital Millenium
Copyright Act, this is formal written notice that thelema93.atspace.com
contains multiple infringement of copyrights and trademarks we exclusively
control. The copyrights are also fully enforcable in Germany, and our
tradmekark for the logo and name "Ordo Templi Orientis" is registered as an
European Community trademark.

I can provide, via email or fax, a copy of our various trademark
registrations upon request. For the US trademark registrations, these are
searchable at the US Patent and Trademark website at

http://www.uspto.gov/main/trademarks.htm

You will get the clearest results by using the New User search option,
selecting "live" marks only, specifying "owner" as the search type from the
dropdown menu, and putting "Ordo Templi Orientis" in the search field. This
will bring current registrations for all three marks complained of here.

I can also, upon request, provide copies of our US Federal Court and United
Kingdom High Court (Chancery Division) decisions establishing our ownership
of the Aleister Crowley copyrights. Our US Federal Court decision also
upholds our ownership of the trademarks of Ordo Templi Orientis.

1. COPYRIGHT

The following pages contain infringing images of Aleister Crowley/Frieda
Harris "Thoth Tarot Deck." This work was jointly created by Aleister Crowley
with Freida Harris.

http://thelema93.atspace.com/index.html
http://thelema93.atspace.com/thelema.html
http://thelema93.atspace.com/documentos.html
http://thelema93.atspace.com//membresia.html

The pages

http://thelema93.atspace.com/manifesto.html
http://thelema93.atspace.com/mensaje.html

  contain unauthorized Spanish translations of English works by Aleister
Crowley that are in copyright in Germany but are public domain in the USA.
(These works are therefore not to be considered a part of the DMCA (US)
component of this complaint.)

The page

http://thelema93.atspace.com/magick.html

  contains an unauthorized Spanish translation of a section of an English
work by Aleister Crowley in excess of fair use that is in copyright in
Germany as well as the United States. The work is titled "Magick in Theory
and Practice."

2. TRADEMARK

The page

http://thelema93.atspace.com/index.html

 infringes our logo artwork (top center), our mark "Ordo Templi Orientis",
and our mark "OTO".

The pages

http://thelema93.atspace.com//membresia.html
http://thelema93.atspace.com/documentos.html

 infringe the mark "OTO"

We demand that Atspace/Zetta Hosting Solutions in Germany, and to
Theplanet.com in the USA, promptly disable access to the infringing
material.

Under penalty of perjury, I swear that the use of the material infringed was
not authorized by Ordo Templi Orientis (a California not-for-profit
corporation), its agent, or the law.

We would be grateful for any information you can provide on the website's
originator, as the originators go to some lengths to avoid identifying
themselves.

The information in this notification is true and accurate.

Sincerely,

/S/


William Breeze
Chief Executive Officer
Ordo Templi Orientis

cc: Robert Clarida, Cowan Liebowitz Latman, P.C. (New York)
    Dr. Karsten M. Gutsche (Rechtsanwalt), Berlin
